snippet: The passage of legislation by the Republican-dominated State Senate has drawn support from the governor, a Democrat.
abstract: Republican-controlled New York State Senate passes a bill requiring all convicted criminals, not just those convicted of felonies, to submit a DNA sample; members of the Democratic-majority State Assembly would approve the measure only if it includes provisions making it easier for defendants to gain access to the database and other evidence; Legislature was unable to overcome a similar stalemate in 2011, but this year both Gov Andrew M Cuomo and Mayor Michael R Bloomberg have targeted the issue for resolution.
lead_paragraph: The passage of legislation by the Republican-dominated State Senate has drawn support from the governor, a Democrat.

headline.seo: Bill to Expand DNA Database Fuels Fight in Albany
